intro: Philenoptera heuglinii, commonly known as the Heuglin's spider orchid, is a rare and endangered species native to the high-altitude grasslands of Ethiopia. It is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance, with elongated, narrow leaves and intricate, delicate flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often covered in fine hairs, and it blooms during the dry season. Philenoptera heuglinii is adapted to harsh, arid environments and requires specific soil and climatic conditions to thrive. Due to habitat loss and overcollection, it is critically endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
